note.p: Diplomatist and author. BA, Cambridge (Trinity College), 1838. Called to the bar, 1840. MP for Weymouth, 1842–7. Consul-general to the Mosquito Territory, 1848; secretary of legatiion the the Swiss confereration, 1851; consul-general to the Argentine Republic, 1854; envoy-extraordinary and minister-plenipotentiary to Brazil, 1859. Retired in 1863.
